alert.note: Alert for Morgan (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 07 at 9:07PM EDT until May 09 at 1:23AM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in West Virginia... Cacapon River near Great Cacapon affecting Morgan County. For the Cacapon River...including Great Cacapon...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cacapon River near Great Cacapon. * WHEN...Until early Monday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM EDT Saturday the stage was 13.7 feet, or 4.7 feet above flood stage. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:30 PM EDT Saturday was 13.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow evening and continue falling to 4.5 feet Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.7 feet on 02/26/1979. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && River Name Fld Observed Sun Sun Sun Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time 2AM 8AM 2PM Stg Time Date Cacapon River Great Cacapon 9.0 13.7 Sat 8 pm 13.3 12.1 10.7 MSG unknown &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/washington or www.weather.gov/baltimore. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning at 915 AM EDT.
